results.title: Phasing in metric designs
results.creator_credit: Stanley Marks, Stephen Cross, New Decade Productions and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keys to Metrication”.
The changeover to metric design will normally be gradual and needs careful preparation. Imperial past can be incorporated in a metric environment of vice versa.

results.title: Inspired design and costume sketches
results.brief_description: Costume designers don’t always rely on sketches of their creations. True History of the Kelly Gang designer Alice Babidge sketches to distil references, while Judy & Punch designer Edie Kurzer gets more inspiration from objects.

constellations_primary.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_primary.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

results.description:
Judy & Punch (2019) costume designer Edie Kurzer often explores mood and atmosphere with images instead of using them as direct influences. While she may use sketches to work through details, she gains more inspiration from objects like feathers, buttons or fabrics, and then works with a fabric cutter, in this case Justine Coultham, who sketches how the costume should be cut and assembled.   

Rather than draw what the finished costume should look like, True History of the Kelly Gang (2019) costume designer Alice Babidge uses sketches to distil various reference images into one thought. For Babidge, drawing helps “refine an idea”, while the torn faces on the photos help the actors imagine how they’ll inhabit the character.
description_for_label:
Judy & Punch (2019) costume designer Edie Kurzer often explores mood and atmosphere with images instead of using them as direct influences. While she may use sketches to work through details, she gains more inspiration from objects like feathers, buttons or fabrics, and then works with a fabric cutter, in this case Justine Coultham, who sketches how the costume should be cut and assembled.   

Rather than draw what the finished costume should look like, True History of the Kelly Gang (2019) costume designer Alice Babidge uses sketches to distil various reference images into one thought. For Babidge, drawing helps “refine an idea”, while the torn faces on the photos help the actors imagine how they’ll inhabit the character.

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 04
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Kip and David”.
David and his elfin friend Kip discover many surprises while playing in the garden. A green tree frog hidden in a plant, a shady Traveller’s palm and newly grown mushrooms - ideal stools for Kip. As they search for a dry, sheltered home for Kip, they see bearded dragon and frilled lizards. After clearing a site at the foot of a tree, they draw a plan and prepare to build it. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 03
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Kip and David”.
On the last day of his holiday at Stradbroke Island, David wakes early, feeds the wild horses, then goes for a swim with Kip, the bushland elf. Later they build a sand castle together and slide down the sand dunes before David smuggles Kip in his bag for a holiday in Brisbane. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: 'Riff Raff the re-mix'
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Kids for kids”.
Riff-Raff, an Australian rock musical that launched the well known band “Men at Work” was re-staged at the Union Theatre, University of Melbourne. The musical touches upon the problems, frustrations and hopes of four teenagers living in the ‘80’s. It featured two Year 12 students who were involved in a professional performance for the first time and they discuss how they benefited from the experience. Contains interviews with the writer/director of the musical, Jan McDonald and writer/actor, Phil Sumner.

results.title: The Indian army
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into India”.
Keith Adam takes a tour of the modern Indian army, paying special attention to a regiment that was once known as the First Bengal Lancers.
